messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Barb E quote
messages.msgSnippet: I thought so too. I read on hummm... lets see Unschooling Cafe I think that that it was really from Stanley. There were urls given and such. I cleaned stuff
messages.messageBody:
I thought so too. I read on hummm... lets see Unschooling Cafe I think
that that it was really from Stanley. There were urls given and such. I
cleaned stuff out and deleted heavily or I'd still have the references. I
knew I should have kept that.;-)


Barb E
"We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty,
charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures
that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open."

- Jawaharlal Nehru, Prime Minister of India




on 8/11/03 7:47 AM, KathrynJB@... at KathrynJB@... wrote:

> In a message dated 8/11/2003 6:50:21 AM Eastern Standard Time,
> AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
>> "To laugh often and much; to win the respect of intelligent people and the
>> affection of children; to earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure
>> the betrayal of false friends; to appreciate beauty; to find the best on
>> others; to leave the world a bit better, whether by a healthy child, a
>> garden path, a redeemed social condition; to know even one life has breathed
>> easier because you have lives. This is to have Succeeded."
>> Bessie Stanley
>>
>>
>
> Barb, this quote is actually from Ralph Waldo Emerson.
>
> Kathryn

messages.subject: Re: Barb E quote
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/11/2003 6:50:21 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Barb, this quote is actually from Ralph Waldo Emerson. Kathryn [Non-text portions of this
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/11/2003 6:50:21 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> "To laugh often and much; to win the respect of intelligent people and the
> affection of children; to earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure
> the betrayal of false friends; to appreciate beauty; to find the best on
> others; to leave the world a bit better, whether by a healthy child, a
> garden path, a redeemed social condition; to know even one life has breathed
> easier because you have lives. This is to have Succeeded."
> Bessie Stanley
>
>

Barb, this quote is actually from Ralph Waldo Emerson.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
